author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Sunday memorialized conservative activist Charlie Kirk, praising his openness to debate and the movement he helped build. Despite the somber tone of the event at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Ariz., Trump’s speech frequently resembled a typical campaign rally or political address. Trump took frequent swipes at his political opponents, even as…
title: Trump memorializes Kirk: ‘He did not hate his opponents. … That’s where I disagreed’

author: Max Rego
description: Erika Kirk, the widow of Charlie Kirk, said Sunday that she forgives the man accused of killing her husband. “On the cross, our savior said, ‘Father, forgive them. For they not know what they do.’ That man. That young man. I forgive him,” Erika Kirk said at her husband’s memorial, with her voice softening and…
title: Erika Kirk says she forgives husband’s accused killer

author: Tara Suter
description: FBI Director Kash Patel said Sunday that his agency is “meticulously investigating theories and questions” in the investigation into conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s shooting. “The full weight of America’s law enforcement agencies are actively following the evidence that has emerged, but our efforts extend beyond initial findings. We are examining every facet of this assassination,”…
title: Patel on Kirk shooting probe: FBI ‘meticulously investigating theories and questions’

author: David Kirichenko, opinion contributor
description: NATO must take a more proactive approach to deter Russian aggression, as Moscow is testing the alliance's defenses and exploiting its reluctance to act, and the West must provide Ukraine with long-range missiles to strike Russian drone factories and shoot down any Russian fighters that violate NATO airspace.
title: Europe’s half-measures only invite Russian escalation

author: Addy Bink
description: Both chambers approved resolutions to honor Charlie Kirk last week.
title: ‘National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk’ resolution passes: When is it?

description: President Trump will be one of the speakers at the memorial service for Charlie Kirk on Sunday in Glendale, Ariz., which is expected to draw tens of thousands of people. Kirk, 31, was fatally shot Sept. 10 at an event on the campus of Utah Valley University in Orem. He is survived by his wife, Erika Kirk, and two children. Other…
title: Watch live: Trump, Vance and others to speak at Charlie Kirk memorial in Arizona

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A number of personalities from media, sports and entertainment are launching bids for political office, underscoring the ways in which the different worlds are converging more and more. In recent months, several reality TV stars have launched campaigns for office. Other media and entertainment personalities have also launched bids, as well as a number of…
title: 5 media, sports and entertainment personalities running for office

author: Anthony O. Maceira, opinion contributor
description: Puerto Rico's Senate has expressed support for President Trump's actions against Maduro and narco-terrorism, and many Puerto Ricans believe that the U.S. military presence can stimulate economic activity, enhance security, and bring the island closer to statehood.
title: Puerto Rico is ready to join the fight against narco-terrorism

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Markwayne Mullin (R-Okla.) said on Sunday he does not share Sen. Ted Cruz’s (R-Texas) concern over free speech after FCC Chair Brendan Carr threatened to “take action” against ABC if it did not address comedian Jimmy Kimmel’s joke about Charlie Kirk’s assassin. In an interview on CNN’s “State of the Union,” Mullin was asked…
title: Senate Republican dismisses Cruz’s free speech warning about Kimmel suspension

author: Max Rego
description: Progressive strategist Faiz Shakir on Sunday questioned whether former Vice President Harris has a political future.  “I doubt it. … People are looking for people with conviction and integrity in time of corruption, economic corruption, political corruption,” Shakir said on ABC’s This Week. “Who’s going to have the honesty and integrity to stand up to…
title: Shakir on Harris having a political future: “I doubt it”

description: Faiz Shakir, an adviser to Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.), said Sunday that President Trump is solely concerned with his “own self-interest.” “This is a person who’s looking out purely for their own self-interest, self preservation,” Shakir said on “ABC’s This Week.” “Me, Trump, my cronyism, go and defend my personal interests, dear Department of Justice,…
title: Shakir says Trump only looking out for “own self interest”

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Sunday it was a “tough day” as he and numerous other White House officials traveled to Arizona for a memorial for Charlie Kirk. “I’m just going to give them my love. There’s nothing much you can say,” Trump told reporters as he left the White House when asked for his message to…
title: Trump on his Kirk memorial speech: ‘I’m just gonna give them my love’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) on Sunday slammed Republicans’ “totally partisan” funding bill and reiterated his push to meet with President Trump as “the only way” to avoid a shutdown. “What we are asking very simply is what has always been done in these kinds of budget negotiations: a bipartisan negotiation. The Republican bill…
title: Schumer slams ‘totally partisan’ GOP funding bill

author: Max Rego
description: Connecticut Sen. Chris Murphy (D) said ‘this is one of the most dangerous moments America has ever faced,’ on Sunday. “This is one of the most dangerous moments America has ever faced,” Murphy told host Jon Karl on ABC’s “This Week.” “We are quickly turning into a banana republic. The president of the United States…
title: Murphy says ‘this is one of the most dangerous moments America has ever faced’

author: Addy Bink
description: At least two states have confirmed the presence of the tick this year.
title: Invasive tick spreads to 23 states: Should you be concerned?

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Border czar Tom Homan on Saturday used a profanity in denying reports alleging he received $50,000 in cash in exchange for contract awards in September of last year.  In response to a question about the allegations from NewsNation’s Libbey Dean, Homan said it was “bulls—.” MSNBC, citing internal documents and multiple people involved with the…
title: Homan denies alleged bribery: ‘bull s—‘

author: Ian Swanson
description: President Trump in a Truth Social post on Saturday demanded that Attorney General Pam Bondi take action against his foes, saying there could be no delay. In the post, Trump listed Sen. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.), New York Attorney General Letitia James, and former FBI Director James Comey while complaining that “nothing is being done.” “They’re…
title: Trump presses Bondi to take legal action against his foes

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump said his administration will make an autism announcement on Monday following a Wall Street Journal report that suggested officials would release information linking Tylenol to the condition in children. “We’re going to have an announcement on autism on Monday,” Trump said during remarks from Mt. Vernon, the historic home of President George Washington…
title: Trump says autism announcement coming on Monday
